fields.descriptive_line: 'Disembarkation of the Expedition to Kertch at Kamish Bournou, and the blowing up of St. Paul’s Battery'. Print, one of 9 plates, from The Seat of the War in the East
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C, case O, shelf 6, box A
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings, Accessions 1952. London: HMSO, 1963. The full text of the entry is as follows: ‘SIMPSON, William, R.I. (1823-1899) […] Plates (9) from The Seat of the War in the East, Second Series by William Simpson, R.I., published by P. & D. Colnaghi & Co., London, 1855. Lithographed by E. Walker, R. M. Bryson, E. Morin and other unidentified artist after drawings made during the Crimean War by W. Simpson, and printed by Day & Son. Each lettered with title, artists’ and publishers’ names etc. Lithotints. Average size 27.9 x 43.2 cm. E.1750-1755, 1757-1759-1952 Given by Westminster City Council Note: The original sketch by W. Simpson upon which E.1757 is based, is in the Department of Prints and Drawings, D.171-1900. Pl. 1 Disembarkation of the Expedition to Kertch at Kamish Bournou, and the blowing up of St. Paul’s Battery. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. E. Walker lith. Published Augt 3rd. 1855. E.1750-1952 Pl. 5 Funeral Cortege of Lord Raglan leaving Head Quarters ]for England]. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. Published Augt. 27th. 1855. Inscribed in pencil Gun Carriage fitted by Capn. Thomas & Coffin drawn by his Troop. E.1751-1952 Pl. 10 Cavalry Camp [outside Sebastapol], July 9th. 1855. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. R. M. Bryson, lith. Published Sept. 27th. 1855. E.1752-1952 Pl. 14 Battle of the Tchernaya 16th August, 1855. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. Published 27th Sepr. 27th 1855. E.1753-1952 Pl. 16 Balaklava showing the state of the Quays & shipping in May 1855. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simspon del. R. Bryson, lith. Published Sepr. 26th. 1855. Pl. 19 The Attack on the Malakoff [by French and Zouave troops on 8 September 1855]. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson, del. E. Morin lith. Published Octr. 22nd. 1855. E.1758-1952 Pl. 20 The Interior of the Redan [after its capture, 8 September 1855]. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. E. Walker, lith. Published Octr. 22nd. 1855. E.1755-1952 Pl. 27 Interior of the Malakoff with the remains of the Round Tower. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson del. E. Morin lith. Published Jany. 24th. 1856. E.1759-1952 Pl. 30 Public Library & Temple of the Winds [Sebastapol, showing the Library burning and Russian troops retreating]. Lettered with title etc. and W. Simpson, del. E. Walker lith. Published Feby. 20th 1856. E.1757-1952’
